Value.label: Default State
Value.Help: After Power-On-Reset of the device, the Channel Output State is set in Default State

Item.label: Channel output state remembers previous state

Value.label: Follow State
Value.Help: This parameter allows Basic Set Commands to be sent when the channel output state changes (ON or OFF). Only the two least significant bits can be addressed. Bit 0: Enable or disable Basic Set Commands sent to associated nodes of Group 2, when Channel Output State changes. Bit 1: Enable or disable Basic Set Commands sent to associated nodes of Group 3, when Channel Output State changes.

Value.label: Always ON
Value.Help: This parameter forces the channel output state to be always ON. It is not possible to turn OFF the channel output, which means that: * All Switch OFF Command is rejected * Basic Set OFF Command is rejected * Binary Switch OFF Command is rejected * Local Control does not toggle channel output state * Product cannot be triggered by unsolicited Notification Report Command and enters in Alarm Mode

Item.label: Channel output state always ON disable
Channel output state always ON enable

Value.label: Auto Power Report
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-100 sends report on x% variation

Value.label: Overload Report
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-4000 sends report on x W overload

Value.label: Auto Energy Report
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-65535 sends report every x seconds

Value.label: Metering Heartbeat
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-65535 sends report every x seconds

Value.label: Power High Treshold
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-65535 x W

Value.label: Power Low Treshold
Value.Help: 0 is disabled. 1-65535 x W

Value.label: Power Low Treshold
Value.Help: 0 disbaled. 1 Send Off to group 4. 3 Send On to group 4. 4 Send Off to group 5. 12 Send On to group 5. Values can be summed
